ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Thesis research, very self-directed and able to learn as much as you pushed yourself to
Great skills in doing a project on my own and pacing myself, tons of knowledge ab immunology and brain cancer
Got a lot of research done for my thesis! Developed wet lab and grant writing skills.
Conduct research, writing a paper
increased experience with research and writing research proposals
I learned how to continue to conduct computational neuroscience research and also formulate a grant proposal. We also started collecting fMRI data by the end which was super exciting.
I learned extensive wet lab skills including working bacterial transformation, protein expression and purification, and data collection using fluorescence and circular dichroism spectroscopy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: very strong but maybe a bit more guidance would be helpful

I think it really depends on your PI. I have an awesome PI and PhD students to help me, so I got lots of mentorship and help. Make sure there will be scheduled meeting times for you and your PI before signing up for a lab!
Almost no guidance from the DUSes

Assignment expectations were clearly communicated via e-mail/Canvas, which was very helpful. The instructors were also very responsive via e-mail. 

However, there was not much course coordinator engagement with students throughout the course. I understand that the course coordinators expect the PIs to give feedback on our work, but it would be helpful if the course coordinators could leave a few comments as feedback for our initial proposals so we can be sure that we are on the right track. Also, it might be helpful to introduce optional office hours where students can go ask questions/ask for guidance; if this resource existed, it was not easily accessible from Canvas.
weakness: deadlines are way too soon also why doesn't canvas also send the papers to our PI's?

I think it's really nice to be able to continue the research I have been doing but understand how to write grant proposals and formulate hypotheses, taking over the direction of research in computational neuroscience. I enjoy what I have been learning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only for the NSCI senior majors
yes
Required for your B.S. in neuroscience. You got this!
If you are a neuroscience major, it is required. Highly recommend choosing your lab and PI carefully, workload and overall experience in this class is highly dependent on that
Needed for nsci majors
This is a required class that must be taken to get a B.S. in neuroscience.
I think working in a lab helps develop tangible skills about teamwork, conducting your own experiments, and understanding how to get back up when you fall down.
